Ablative Barrier Block.name: Ablative Barrier Block
Ablative Barrier Block.description:
Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade stance and are wielding a shield or have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield} spell prepared.

You use the reserved power of your cascade to create a strong barrier to protect you and allies. If your next action is to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield}, you can create a barrier that surrounds you in a 5- or 10-foot emanation as well as the normal effects of your Raise a Shield action. This barrier grants allies within the emanation partial cover and your allies can use the Take Cover action to give themselves standard cover while your shield is raised. The barrier is transparent and allies cannot use this cover to Hide or Sneak.

Battlemage's Apotheosis: Ultimate Radian.name: Battlemage's Apotheosis: Ultimate Radiance
Battlemage's Apotheosis: Ultimate Radian.description:
Requirements Your Spellstrike is charged.

Summoning a powerful aura of energy and performing some long forgotten techniques, you unleash violent power and the glow of your Arcane Cascade grows substantially, changing the color of your hair and eyes as you stand strong. You enter Arcane Cascade and gain additional effects. You exude bright light out to 20 feet and dim light 20 feet after that, gain a fly speed equal to your Speed, and regeneration (deactivated by force damage or critical hits) 15. These benefits last as long as you remain in your current Arcane Cascade stance.

Cascading Weapon Blast.name: Cascading Weapon Blast
Cascading Weapon Blast.description: You fire blasts of magic out of your weapon into nearby opponents. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.rBPkrPH0L6ZDB4Lb]{Cascading Weapon Blast} conflux spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Cone of Figments.name: Cone of Figments
Cone of Figments.description:
Requirement Your Spellstrike is charged.

You infuse your spellstrike with a storm of figments. Make a thrown Spellstrike against a target within your bonded weapons first range increment. The spell you cast for the Spellstrike can't be a cantrip or focus spell. If your Strike is successful, figments burst forth from the connecting blow in a @Template[type:cone|distance:10] bursting from behind the target of your Spellstrike and creatures in the area, excluding the target of your Spellstrike, take 1d4 damage per spell level and must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)|basic:true|traits:magical,conjuration] save.

If your spell was one that can deal damage, the damage of your Cone of Figments is the same type that spell could deal (or one type of your choice if the spell could deal multiple types of damage). If the spell couldn't deal damage, the bonus damage depends on the spell's school.

  • Abjuration or Evocation force
  • Conjuration or Transmutation same type as your weapon or unarmed attack
  • Divination, Enchantment, or Illusion mental
  • Necromancy negative or positive damage if your spell had the positive trait

Dealer of Death.name: Dealer of Death
Dealer of Death.description:
You have learned to wield harrow and other decks of cards as deadly weapons via imbuing them with powerful magic. You gain a harrow deck or other deck of cards as appropriate when you gain this feat. During your daily preparations, you can infuse a deck of cards with your magic allowing you to use the cards as simple weapons of the knife group that deal [[/r 1d6[slashing]]] damage with the agile, finesse, thrown 10 ft., and versatile p traits. Infused decks do not reduce the number of cards in the deck when they are drawn and cards that are destroyed or removed from the deck are replenished magically after 1 minute.

If you make a Spellstrike with a card from your infused deck with a spell that deals damage, roll 1d6 on the table below. If the damage of the spell matches the card drawn, you deal additional damage of the listed type equal to the level of the spell you used for your Spellstrike or half your level if the spell was a cantrip.

  • Hammers: cold damage
  • Keys: fire damage
  • Shields: poison damage
  • Books: electricity damage
  • Stars: mental damage
  • Crowns: acid damage

Devouring Metal.name: Devouring Metal
Devouring Metal.description:
Trigger You critically hit a living creature.

Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade stance.

Your weapons and magic not only fuel your might, they also seek to devour your enemies when you make a telling blow. The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] save against your spell DC.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and you regain Hit Points equal to the number of Hit Points the target lost from the drained condition. If you would regain more Hit Points than you have, you instead gain temporary Hit Points for the excess amount that lasts until you are no longer in Arcane Cascade. These temporary Hit Points stack with any Hit Points you would gain from the Arcane Cascade stance.

Failure As success but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}.

Critical Failure As success, but the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3}.

Diametric Pairing.name: Diametric Pairing
Diametric Pairing.description:
Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade and on your last action you critically succeeded at a Strike with one of your diametric weapons while wielding your other diametric weapon.

You have learned to fuse your weapons into a singular fighting style, often apply a specific name to this fusion such as dance of the sun and moon, crash of thunder and lighting, or something even more eclectic. You unleash diametric energy from your other weapon and the target of the required Strike takes [[/r (1d4*ceil(@actor.level/2))[@actor.flags.pf2e.arcaneCascade.damageType]]] on a basic save determined below. Targets that fail their save also suffer the effects of your other diametric weapon's critical specialization. The save for the damage and critical specialization effect is against your spell DC with a save type that matches the weapon's critical specialization or a Reflex save if there was no save. The target rolls once to determine the effects of the damage and the critical specialization.

@Check[type:fortitude|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)|basic:true|traits:magical]

@Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)|basic:true|traits:magical]

@Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)|basic:true|traits:magical]

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.journals.JournalEntry.S55aqwWIzpQRFhcq.JournalEntryPage.PVrMSF93KIejBTMm]{Critical Specialization Effects}

Discern Physicality.name: Discern Physicality
Discern Physicality.description:
Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade stance.

You have trained yourself to be able to scan the level of a creature's physical power with a glance. Make a @Check[type:perception] check or the appropriate knowledge skill against a creature's Recall Knowledge DC and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your check. This bonus increases to 2 if you have weapon specialization and 3 if you have greater weapon specialization. The GM might apply a penalty for the distance between you and the enemy. The enemy is then temporarily immune to your Discern Physicality for 1 day.

Critical Success The GM chooses two of the following pieces of information about the enemy to tell you: one of its passive abilities, actions, or activities, the attack modifier for one of its Strikes, its spell DC, or its highest skill modifier. In the event of a tie, the GM should pick one at random. You gain a +2 status bonus to damage against that creature as long as you are in Arcane Cascade.

Success As a critical success, except you only receive one piece of information and the status bonus to damage while in Arcane Cascade is +1 instead of +2.

Elaborate Patterned Strike.name: Elaborate Patterned Strike
Elaborate Patterned Strike.description:
Your ability to rapidly make attacks allows you to emblazon your enemies with an elaborate set of runes that hinder them further. When you cast dual-pattern strike, you can choose to cast the spell as a 2-action or 3-action spell and gain additional effects.

  • 2 (somatic, verbal) Make an additional Strike with each of your diametric weapons. For each Strike that hits after the second, increase the weakness from your dual-pattern strike by 1 and apply any weakness from dual-pattern strike before applying any damage from any of your Strikes.
  • 3 (somatic, verbal) As the 2-action version of the spell, except an eruption of magical energy bursts after the pattern is complete and the target takes 1d4 damage per spell level of the spell on a basic Reflex save after the Strikes are made. The damage dealt is of the same type as the weakness you chose.

@Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)|basic:true|traits:magical]

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[acid]]]{1d4 acid damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[cold]]]{1d4 cold damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[electricity]]]{1d4 electricity damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[fire]]]{1d4 fire damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[force]]]{1d4 force damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[mental]]]{1d4 mental damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[void]]]{1d4 negative damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[poison]]]{1d4 poison damage per spell level}

[[/r ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[vitality]]]{1d4 positive damage per spell level}

Enhanced Fortification.name: Enhanced Fortification
Enhanced Fortification.description:
When you reshape your armor, you do so perfectly, effectively becoming a brand new suit of armor. You can choose two effects when you cast metamorphic armor instead of one. When you make a Strike during the spell’s duration, you can only swap one of these effects to another effect as normal. Add the following options to the options you have when you cast metamorphic armor.

  • You grant your armor an additional armor property rune equal to half your level. This property rune does not count towards the maximum runes your armor can have.
  • You change the material your armor is made of to another material; this material must be able to be made into an armor, and the armor material must be equal or lower than your level.
  • You can grant your armor an adjustment less than or equal to half your level. It can gain this adjustment even if the armor could not normally sustain the adjustment (such as burnished plating on hide armor).
  • You can reduce the Speed penalty of your armor by 5 feet and can remove the Hindering and Noisy traits.

Essence Eating Shell.name: Essence Eating Shell
Essence Eating Shell.description:
You have learned that the price of more potent spellshells is infusing it with an essence that taxes your very being. During your daily preparation, you can choose to make one of your shells an essence eating shell. When you make a Spellstrike with one of these shells, you and the initial target of the Spellstrike are affected by an additional effect determined by the spell that was chosen for the spellshell. As long as your attack roll was not a critical failure, the target suffers the effects listed below. You also suffer the listed effect, but you gain a +3 status bonus to saves against the effect if your Spellstrike was successful and you treat your degree of success as one better if you get a critical success.

  • Abjuration (force) The creature is trapped inside a cube of force which attempts to compress itself around the creature. The creature takes 1d4 force damage per level of the spell and must attempt a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail their save are also immobilized for 1 round.
  • Conjuration (teleportation) The creature is blinked between existence, rupturing its form. The creature must attempt a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC and takes 1d4 bludgeoning and 1d4 slashing damage per level of the spell. On a failed save, the creature must attempt a DC 5 flat check to use actions with the manipulate trait for 1 round as they phase in and out of existence.
  • Divination (emotion, fear, mental) The creature sees a vision of their death. The creature takes 1d6 mental damage per spell level of the spell and must attempt a basic Will save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail their save are frightened 1 or frightened 2 on a critical failure.
  • Enchantment (mental) The creature's mind is bound to a mental prison. The creature must attempt a Will save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail their save are stupefied 2 for 1 round, or confused for 1 round on a critical failure. If a creature would gain the dying condition from the Spellstrike that caused this effect, the duration of the confused and stupefied conditions increases to permanent, but the creature can attempt a new save against the effect each day.
  • Evocation The creature is blasted with essence manipulation. The creature takes an additional amount of damage from your Spellstrike equal to the level of the spell you cast and must attempt a basic Reflex save. Determine the damage type as described in Arcane Cascade. Creatures that fail their save also apply a weakness to the damage type equal to the spell's level or reduce any resistances they have to the damage type by the same amount. If a creature with immunity to the damage type fails their save, they take half damage of that damage type. This effect occurs at the same time as the Spellstrike and applies any weaknesses or reductions in resistances to the Spellstrike's damage if they would apply.
  • Illusion (mental, visual) The creature is absorbed into a false reality. The creature must attempt a Will save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail their save treat all areas around them as difficult terrain for 1 minute or greater difficult terrain if their save was a critical failure. Any creature that moves through the area or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve this illusion.
  • Necromancy (death) The creature is bombarded with a sphere of death. The creature takes 1d8 negative damage per level of the spell or positive damage if the spell had the positive trait and must attempt a Fortitude save against your spell DC. Creatures that fail their save are also drained 2 and creatures that critically fail their save are drained 4. If a creature is reduced to 0 Hit Points from the damage of this effect or the drained condition, it is instantly slain and attempts to communicate with it, return it to life, turn it into an undead, or otherwise disturb its afterlife fail unless the effect's counteract level is higher than half your level when you killed the creature (rounded up), or originates from an artifact or a deity. If any creature would not be affected by the type of damage dealt by this effect, this effect does not occur for any creature and fizzles, but the effects of the Spellstrike still apply normally.
  • Transmutation (morph) The creature's inner anatomy is morphed by your shell, causing bodily stress and difficulty operating. The creature must attempt a Fortitude save and becomes sickened 2 on a failure, or sickened 3 on a critical failure. While a creature is sickened they also take a –10- foot status penalty to their Speeds. A creature that is immune to the sickened condition instead takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage per level of the spell on a basic Fortitude save and suffers the status penalty to Speeds for 1 round after taking damage from a failure of this effect.

Special You can take this feat multiple times, gaining the ability to create an additional essence eating spellshell each time you select it.

Essence Mystic Dedication.name: Essence Mystic Dedication
Essence Mystic Dedication.description:
You have strengthened your connection to your havok. You gain the conflux spell associated with the hybrid study you chose for your essence tactics, and you increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

When you cast a conflux spell that does not have the havok trait, you can choose to give it the havok trait, giving you a +1 status bonus to any attacks you make as part of Casting the Spell and doubling the damage from your havok cascade until the beginning of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.Ee5RMHDGu9vX9oOj]{Effect: Essence Mystic Dedication}

Eternally Rebounding Figments.name: Eternally Rebounding Figments
Eternally Rebounding Figments.description: Your figments continue to rebound until you miss. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.y9uj8UHvnUWdwpc0]{Rebounding Figment Strike}, your rebounding figment strike can continue to make thrown Strikes with your figments so long as there is another creature within your weapon's range increment to target with a thrown Strike and your previous Strike was successful. You cannot target a creature more than once with one of these Strikes, even if your previous Strike was against another creature. In addition, the first Strike of your rebounding figment strike does not increase your multiple attack penalty.

Inverted Energy Spellstrike.name: Inverted Energy Spellstrike
Inverted Energy Spellstrike.description:
Requirements Your Spellstrike is charged and you can cast at least one spell that deals energy damage.

Your weapon-wielding dance serves as the final line of an arcane equation that rewrites the elemental power of a spell. Make a Spellstrike with a spell you can cast that deals energy damage (acid, cold, electricity, fire, force, negative, positive, or sonic). You can change the damage of that spell to another damage type of your choice and the spell loses any traits of the previous damage type and gains the one associated with its new damage type. If the spell you chose would deal more than one type of damage, you select one applicable damage type and any other damage remains the same.

Living Grimoire.name: Living Grimoire
Living Grimoire.description:
Eschewing the need for a spellbook, you write your spells into the most sacred of vellum: yourself. You may scribe spells onto your skin as if it were suitable parchment in a process that takes the same amount of time that it would to scribe a scroll. This may look like a sleeve of tattoos made of words, markings on the back of your hand in an ancient script or some other body art. You may use your body as your spellbook and may prepare your spells from your body during your daily preparations.

Your body gains the following grimoire power and it does not count as your one grimoire for the day.

Activate f envision (mental, visual)

Frequency once per day

Effect If your next action is to Spellstrike, the runes inscribed on your body swirl to emphasize your attack. The target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Dazzled]{Dazzled} until the end of your next turn if your Spellstrike was a success or 1 minute if it was a critical success. Creatures that are dazzled from this effect take a –1 circumstance penalty to their attack rolls against you as long as they are dazzled.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.2VcmRCrUc37OSa9y]{Effect: Living Grimoire}

Mediation of Insight.name: Mediation of Insight
Mediation of Insight.description:
You spend 10 minutes to enter a state that merges your mental and physical form through magic, showing the certain future of your actions and granting you the power to forge an outcome. The next time you roll initiative for an encounter, you can choose to state a specific action or activity as the first action or activity for your first turn. Once you do, this action is locked in and you must attempt it on your first turn. If you fail to perform this action or otherwise are unable to take the action mentioned, you lose any actions that would have been required to take the named action. When you attempt your declared action, you gain a +1 status bonus to the first attack roll or check you attempt and you treat the degree of success on a result of a failure or critical failure as one better.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.cI71YviGF5ER5wqC]{Effect: Mediation of Insight}

Merged Martial Stance.name: Merged Martial Stance
Merged Martial Stance.description:
You have learned to merge the effects of your Arcane Cascade with powerful martial arts. Choose a level 1 monk feat with the stance trait. You gain that feat as a magus class feat and can take feats that have it or subsequent feats as a prerequisites. For the purpose of meeting their prerequisites, your monk level is equal to your character level.

You can use your Arcane Cascade while in the selected stance and you can enter this stance as part of entering an Arcane Cascade, allowing you to enter the two stances at once. When you first enter these stances and at the beginning of each turn you are in Arcane Cascade and your chosen stance, you must choose either Arcane Cascade or your chosen stance as your primary stance. For the purposes of actions, effects, or abilities that would require you to be in a stance, you are in the stance you chose. You must still meet the requirements for both stances, otherwise the stance whose requirements you failed to meet immediately ends.

Multi-Faceted Visage.name: Multi-Faceted Visage
Multi-Faceted Visage.description:
Requirements Your visage is donned.

Your visage can be altered on a whim. You alter your selection from Don Visage to another option of your choice, changing your demeanor to that of your new selection and replacing the benefits with your new demeanor.

Perfect Arcane Form.name: Perfect Arcane Form
Perfect Arcane Form.description:
As you allow your magic to flow through you, you overlap yourself with the ideal arcane form that you channel your spells from. This form may look identical to you, or it may have extra ethereal arms, glowing organs, or some other unusual appearance. You enter a battle form for 1 minute. You have hands in this battle form and can take actions with the manipulate trait. While you are in this battle form, you gain the benefits of Arcane Cascade and are considered to be in Arcane Cascade for the purposes of feats or activities that would require it. You also gain the following benefits.

  • 20 temporary Hit Points.
  • If you were Medium or smaller, you can increase your size to Large provided you have the space to do so and your unarmed attacks reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if it started out Tiny).
  • A fly Speed equal to your Speed.
  • A +1 status bonus to saves against spells.
  • You gain a precise sense with a range of 30 feet that enables you to sense arcane magic and creatures or items with the arcane trait.
  • Increase the damage die of your melee unarmed attacks by 1, up to a maximum of d10. If your damage die was already d10 or above, you instead gain a +2 status bonus to damage with your melee unarmed Strikes.
  • You gain a ranged unarmed attack (magical, range increment 30 feet, unarmed), which deals 1d6 force damage.

Pummeling Spellstrike.name: Pummeling Spellstrike
Pummeling Spellstrike.description:
Requirements You're in Arcane Cascade stance, are unarmed, and your Spellstrike is charged.

You unleash your pummeling blow with a dazzling display of martial prowess, carrying a powerful force behind it. Make a Spellstrike. It gains the following effects in addition to the normal effects of your Spellstrike.

Critical Success You push your target up to 10 feet away from you after your Spellstrike resolves. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Success You push your target back 5 feet after the Spellstrike resolves. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Special If you have Merged Martial Cascade, you can use Pummelling Strike in the stance you chose as well as Arcane Cascade.

Puppet's Command.name: Puppet's Command
Puppet's Command.description:
Requirements You have two puppet strings attached to a single enemy.

Your puppet strings allow you to force the target to take an action. You can use your puppet strings to make the target approach you, release what it's holding, drop prone, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] save against your spell DC. The target takes a status penalty to their save against this effect equal to the number puppet strings in excess of two. Regardless of the result, the target is then immune to your Puppet’s Command for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immediately breaks one of your puppet strings.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Recharging Reload.name: Recharging Reload
Recharging Reload.description: Recharging and reloading, go together like a target and shot. You Reload and then recharge your Spellstrike.

Rewrite Rune.name: Rewrite Rune
Rewrite Rune.description: Perhaps nobody understands the fundamentals of a magic weapon as well as you do. With a tap, you can shift the runes of a weapon around like liquid following your touch. You can add or remove runes of a weapon or armor in an activity that takes 1 hour. You can change the rune of a weapon or armor to be another rune of the same level or lower in this time, but the rune you select must be of equal or lower cost than the original rune. When you remove a rune from a weapon, you can move it to another appropriate weapon or to an ordinary stone, making it a runestone in the process.

Ride the Spell.name: Ride the Spell
Ride the Spell.description: You conjure up a spell beneath your feet, which you ride directly into your opponent. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a range or area of effect, you ride atop it to its destination, moving alongside it up to 60 feet. This movement ignores any difficult or greater difficult terrain and allows you to travel over obstacles or gaps, flying above them and landing in a square adjacent to your spell's target or destination. If the spell you cast was an area of effect, you can choose to end your movement within the area or at a square adjacent to the affected area.

Scent of Arcana.name: Scent of Arcana
Scent of Arcana.description: You have found that the pungency of magic can actually permeate the air, allowing you to sense its presence through scent. While in Arcane Cascade, you gain an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet that enables you to smell arcane magic. This scent allows you to detect the presence of arcane magic equal to or lower than your level as well as beasts, constructs, dragons, elementals, or creatures with the ability to cast arcane spells or use actions with the arcane trait. In addition, you can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Track]{Track} these creatures using your Arcana instead of Survival and you gain a +2 status bonus to track these creatures if you pass through an area or place where they have used a magical ability or Cast a Spell within 1 hour while tracking them. If you are a master in Arcana, you gain this bonus if you pass an area or place within 1 day of using a magical ability or Cast a Spell instead of 1 hour.

Second-Hand Wand.name: Second-Hand Wand
Second-Hand Wand.description: You have learned to blend your combat style with that of wands. The hand you use to wield a wand counts as a free hand for the purposes of the Interact action and for feats or abilities that would require you have a free hand. You can also hold another object in this hand (but you still can't use it to wield a weapon). You can Spellstrike with wands of appropriate spells and when you make a Spellstrike by overcharging a wand, you reduce the flat check needed to succeed to 5 instead of 10.

Serpentine Flail.name: Serpentine Flail
Serpentine Flail.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon in the flail group.

Your weapon can twist and slither, like a serpent. You infuse your flail with life, giving it a Command and allowing you to issue it further commands for up to 1 minute. Your flail gains 2 actions when you issue it a Command and it can use these actions to make simple Interact actions, move 10 feet by sliding on a surface, or Seek with an imprecise motion sense of 15 feet. Your flail can't perform actions that require significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, and you can't use it to hold items. Your flail can slide up sheer surfaces such as a wall and can fit through holes or areas appropriate for its size. Your flail can communicate with you via touch telepathy but it can only convey simple words or sentences when it does.

Slide Slice.name: Slide Slice
Slide Slice.description:
Trigger You used Slidecast before you made a Spellstrike and the Strike from your Spellstrike was a critical hit.

You carry your slide through your opponent after making a devastating blow. You can Stride up to half your Speed. You can make this Stride before or after the effects of your spell are applied.

Sky Fall.name: Sky Fall
Sky Fall.description:
Requirements You're wielding a ranged or thrown weapon, or have a ranged unarmed attack and you’re in Arcane Cascade stance.

You call to the skies to rain down on your enemies using your weapon as a conduit for the impending sky fall. Make a ranged Strike with the required weapon or unarmed attack, but do not resolve the effects of this attack. At the end of your next turn, resolve the attack roll you made by comparing it to the AC of all enemies within a @Template[type:burst|distance:15] in the first or second range increment of the required weapon. Any natural or constructed ground that was included in the area becomes difficult terrain from the resulting blast.

Spell Stitcher.name: Spell Stitcher
Spell Stitcher.description:
After getting in a few scrapes, you've learned to spin arcane thread and imbue tools with special magic for mending wounds and destruction. You can use your proficiency rank in Arcana to meet the requirements of skill feats that require a particular rank in Medicine. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine} skill feat. During your daily preparations, you can imbue a set of healer's tools with arcane power that in your hands allows you to use Arcana for actions that would normally require Medicine.

While you are in Arcane Cascade, your imbued tools heal targets of your Battle Medicine for 1 additional Hit Point, or 2 additional Hit Points if you critically succeeded. These additional Hit Points increase to 2 and 4 if you have weapon specialization and to 3 and 6 if you have greater weapon specialization.

Time Splitting Spellstrike.name: Time Splitting Spellstrike
Time Splitting Spellstrike.description: You apply a technique of temporal distortion to delay the effects of an upcoming Spellstrike. If your next action is to make a Spellstrike, you can delay the effects of the spell you cast for up to 3 rounds. At the beginning of each of your turns, you can choose to cause the spell to take effect using the Strike of the Spellstrike you made to determine the effects. If a spell would need to originate from a square you occupied, such as an area of effect spell with an Expansive Spellstrike, you can choose any square adjacent to the target for the purposes of the spell you cast.

Unbreakable Figure.name: Unbreakable Figure
Unbreakable Figure.description:
Trigger You would take damage.

Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade stance and are wearing medium or heavy armor.

You merge with your armor entirely, wrapping your entire body in armor and sheathing you from the coming blow. You reduce the damage you would take by 25, and gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition until the end of your next turn. You cannot Escape or otherwise remove this immobilized condition and the DC of this effect is equal to your spell DC.

Warded Stitch.name: Warded Stitch
Warded Stitch.description:
Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade.

You patch your target with a special imbued stitch that protects them against certain harm. You use Battle Medicine on an appropriate creature using your Arcana for the check. If you are successful, you do not apply the effects of your Battle Medicine immediately but instead place a warded stitch on the target creature that lasts for 1 minute. While the warded stitch is active, it provides the target creature with a +1 status bonus to saves against death effects, diseases, negative effects, and poisons. Once during the duration, you or the target creature can use a single action with the concentrate trait to grant the effects of the Battle Medicine to the creature with your warded stitch. When your warded stitch is expended, you immediately recharge your Spellstrike.

Whirling Wand Strike.name: Whirling Wand Strike
Whirling Wand Strike.description: You have adapted your wand techniques to enhance merging wands and attacks. You can cast a spell from a wand that takes 1 or 2 actions and can make a Strike against a creature. You can choose the order in which these occur and can target different creatures. Alternatively, you can choose to Spellstrike with your wand if it possesses an appropriate spell and you gain a status bonus to damage equal to half the spell's level on your Spellstrike. If you choose to Spellstrike by overcharging a wand, you ignore the flat check to prevent your wand from being destroyed (though it still becomes broken as normal).

Arcane Fists+.name: Arcane Fists+
Arcane Fists+.description:
Your physical training encompasses unarmed combat forms. The damage die for your fist changes to 1d6 instead of 1d4. You don't take the normal -2 circumstance penalty when making a lethal attack with your fist or any other unarmed attacks. Your unarmed attacks gain the arcane trait, making them magical. At 5th level, you also gain the critical specialization effects of unarmed attacks in the brawling group and weapons in the brawling group.

You use your spell DC instead of your class DC for your critical specialization.

Banishing Spellstrike.name: Banishing Spellstrike
Banishing Spellstrike.description:
Requirements Your Spellstrike is charged.

 When you strike an extra-planar foe, you can channel anti-summoning magic that disrupts their tether to this world. Make a Spellstrike against a creature that isn't on its home plane. If it hits, the target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] save against your spell DC. If your Spellstrike deals damage to the target that would trigger a weakness, the target takes a –2 circumstance penalty to its save. If the creature you targeted with your Spellstrike has the summoned trait, this ability loses the incapacitation trait.

Critical Success The target resists being banished and you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Stunned]{Stunned 1}.

Success The target resists being banished.

Failure The target is banished.

Critical Failure The target is banished and can't return by any means to the plane it's banished from for 1 week.

Dual-Weapon Spellstrike.name: Dual-Weapon Spellstrike
Dual-Weapon Spellstrike.description:
Requirements You are wielding both your diametric weapons, are in @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-class-features.Item.SkUkDSnIU1LHBSHf]{Arcane Cascade+} stance, and your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.KVj5ofUwu3VJSrVw]{Spellstrike} is charged.

You can swing your weapons in tandem, the power of your spell carried between the two. Make a Spellstrike but when you do make two Strikes, one with each of your two diametric weapons, each using your current multiple attack penalty. Both Strikes must have the same target. Your second Strike is made with a –3 penalty, or a –2 penalty if it has the agile trait.

If either of your Strikes are successful, you gain the effects of your Spellstrike, using the first successful Strike to determine the effects of your Spellstrike.

If neither of your Strikes are successful, you use the first Strike you made to determine the effects of your Spellstrike if it would have an effect on a failure, such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.84n92oBsRVCxjifM]{Expansive Spellstrike}.

Eat This!.name: Eat This!
Eat This!.description:
Requirements You are in Arcane Cascade, you have at least one spellshell, and your Spellstrike is charged.

You take one of your spellshells and fire it with extreme prejudice. Make a Spellstrike with a spellshell. Increase the radius of your weapon's scatter trait by 5 feet and increase the additional damage of the scatter trait to be equal to the spell's level instead of the normal amount.

Flaying Spellstrike.name: Flaying Spellstrike
Flaying Spellstrike.description:
Requirements You're in Arcane Cascade stance, are wielding a weapon in the flail group, and your Spellstrike is charged.

Your spellstrike tears through the essences of your opponents, aggravating their greatest flaws and empowering your attack in tandem. Make a Spellstrike and an @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-macros.Macro.dsKBde1bk00K7vyZ]{Arcana} check immediately after to identify weak points with your magic to flay them. On a success, the creature gains a weakness of 3 to a damage type of your choice that lasts until the end of your next turn or double this amount if you critically succeed. The base weakness amount increases to 5 if you have weapon specialization or 7 if you have greater weapon specialization. The target gains these weaknesses before your Spellstrike deals damage.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.M313i07uS7llBE89]{Effect: Flaying Spellstrike}

Force Jaws.name: Force Jaws
Force Jaws.description:
You have learned to harness your force fang from a single devastating blow to an onslaught. The form of your force fang often changes to resemble something specific, such as a creature or object when you Cast the Spell in this way. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang}, you can choose to Cast the Spell as a 2-action or 3-action spell to gain additional effects.

  • 2 (somatic, verbal) Your force jaws swiftly assault your target. Creatures that take damage from your force fang must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:resolve(@actor.attributes.spellDC.value)] save against your spell DC or be knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone} as the jaws pull them down.
  • 3 (somatic, verbal) As the 2-action version of the spell, except you can change the target from a single creature to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], @Template[type:line|distance:30], or @Template[type:burst|distance:5] within 30 feet.

Force Manipulate.description: You use one of the most consistent elements at your disposal: Force. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.YKclj7gZLxn9uWMm]{Force Manipulate} conflux spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
Force Manipulate.name: Force Manipulate

Guarded Spellstrike.name: Guarded Spellstrike
Guarded Spellstrike.description:
Requirements Your Spellstrike is charged.

You have learned to guard your spellstrikes from enemies who would interrupt you. Make a Spellstrike. The spell you cast as part of your Spellstrike does not provoke reactions.

Hundred Year Growth.name: Hundred Year Growth
Hundred Year Growth.description:
Requirements You are wielding a staff.

You plant your staff into the ground, literally, and it ages a hundred years in an instant. Choose an unoccupied square adjacent to you to plant your staff, which becomes a Huge tree. Creatures that occupy the area are automatically moved to the nearest available square and you may Step as part of your staff’s growth.

While your staff is in this form, you can still make Strikes with it as if it were a staff that you were wielding in two hands except its reach is increased by 10 feet and it can only attack from its current space. You can still make Spellstrikes as long as you are adjacent to your tree staff. The tree cannot be moved, but it has an AC of 10, Hardness equal to your level, and a number of Hit Points equal to your level x 10. The tree reverts back to its staff form if you Dismiss this effect, its Hit Points are reduced to 0, or 1 minute has passed. When it reverts back to staff form it falls on the square you originally chose for Hundred Year Growth or in your hands if you were adjacent to the tree at the time it reverted to staff form.

Imposing Spellstrike.name: Imposing Spellstrike
Imposing Spellstrike.description:
Requirements You're in Arcane Cascade, you are wearing heavy armor, and your Spellstrike is charged

The appearance of your mighty armor is enough to make even the most foolhardy of opponents doubt themselves. Make a Spellstrike. It gains the following effects in addition to the normal effects of your Spellstrike.

Critical Success The target takes a –2 status penalty to its Will saves and a –3 status penalty to fear effects until the end of your next turn.

Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to its Will saves and a –2 status penalty to fear effects until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-effects.Item.aVjNPD9mbmvdOUj0]{Effect: Imposing Spellstrike}

Mutable Figments.name: Mutable Figments
Mutable Figments.description: Your figments have become alterable, allowing you to shift them to your needs. You alter the form of your figments to take the shape of another non-consumable thrown weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. Your figments remain in this form until you use this action again. The figment's runes apply to their new shape. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the figments take a shape to which they can apply.

Mystic Bomb.name: Mystic Bomb
Mystic Bomb.description: You can create a powerful reservoir of magic that you, and others, can fuel. You learn the @UUID[Compendium.magus.magus-focus-spells.Item.Dv93B6mBVmsiu2ds]{Mystic Bomb} conflux spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.

Reservoir of Power.name: Reservoir of Power
Reservoir of Power.description:
Requirements Your most recent action was to Cast a Spell from a spell slot or make a Spellstrike with a spell from a spell slot.

When you tap into the inner energies of your arcane cascade's power, using it to create additional effects. You use Arcane Cascade and you gain an effect depending on the school of your most recent spell that lasts until the end of your next turn.

  • Abjuration You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC.
  • Conjuration You can Step 10 feet.
  • Divination You gain a +2 status bonus to Perception to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Seek]{Seek} against @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Hidden]{Hidden} creatures and treat the flat check to target concealed or hidden creatures as 2 lower.
  • Enchantment You gain a +1 status bonus to Deception and Intimidation.
  • Evocation You gain a +2 status bonus to Reflex saves against spells that would deal the same damage as your Arcane Cascade.
  • Illusion You create illusory difficult terrain in a square adjacent to you. You treat this difficult terrain as normal terrain. A creature can attempt to disbelieve the effect as normal after using a Seek action or otherwise spending actions interacting with the illusion. If it successfully disbelieves, it ignores this effect for the duration of your Arcane Cascade.
  • Necromancy You gain a +2 status bonus against death effects and regain a number of Hit Points equal to the 9 damage value of your Arcane Cascade before applying any additional effects (such as the bonus from laughing shadow).
  • Transmutation You gain a +2 status bonus against forced movement and to saves against effects that would give you the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Immobilized]{Immobilized} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Prone]{Prone} conditions.

Reverse Spellstrike.name: Reverse Spellstrike
Reverse Spellstrike.description:
Requirements Your Spellstrike is charged and you were targeted with a hostile spell you could Spellstrike with in the last turn.

You reverse the ambient magic from the spell cast and divert it into a powerful attack. You expend a spell slot of your highest level, and Spellstrike with the same spell that targeted you. If the spell is of a level lower than your highest spell slot, it is heightened to the highest level spell you can cast.

Second Conservation.name: Second Conservation
Second Conservation.description: You have mastered new ways to wield the ambient magic of an arcane cascade. You gain a second Arcane Conservation. You can only be in one of your Arcane Cascades at once, and if you would put yourself in an Arcane Cascade, you must choose one of your two Arcane Conservations.

Splinter Shadow Assault.name: Splinter Shadow Assault
Splinter Shadow Assault.description:
You designate your shadow to splinter so that you surround your target with shadows of yourself before attacking them from all directions at once. When you cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5p9Y4ACrtRM4gTpN]{Dimensional Assault}, you can choose to cast the spell as a 2-action or 3-action spell instead of the normal effect.

  • 2 (somatic, verbal) You splinter your shadow into three locations that would be in range of your dimensional assault that would also allow you to Strike the target. Make three Strikes, one from each location you chose, teleporting between your shadows to make these Strikes and choosing their order. Each of these Strikes increases your multiple attack penalty as normal, but you treat each square your shadows occupy as occupied by an ally for the purposes of flanking. For each attack that hits, combine their damage for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.
  • 3 (somatic, verbal) As the 2-action version of the spell, except you splinter your shadow into four locations and your multiple attack penalty only increases by -3 (or -2 if you used an agile weapon) after each of these Strikes.

Steady Spellcasting+.name: Steady Spellcasting+
Steady Spellcasting+.description:
Confident in your technique, you don’t easily lose your concentration when you Cast a Spell. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:10] flat check. If you succeed, your action isn’t disrupted.

In addition, if you cast a non-cantrip spell that was disrupted by a reaction, you do not expend the focus point or spell slot even if your spell was disrupted.

Storm of the Winding Lash.name: Storm of the Winding Lash
Storm of the Winding Lash.description:
Requirements You are wielding a weapon in the flail group and are in Arcane Cascade.

You empower your flail's lashing power and twirl, cutting through the souls of all those around you and winding its way around them. Make a melee Strike or Grapple check with a flail against up to 3 enemies within your flail’s reach. Each attack counts toward your multiple attack penalty, but do not increase your penalty until you have made all your attacks. If you Grappled more than one creature, you can maintain the Grapple against all creatures you grappled with this activity with a single Grapple check by comparing the result of your check against the Fortitude DCs of each creature separately. Creatures can still attempt to Escape as normal and if you would get a critical failure against any creature you made a Grapple against, you drop your flail immediately.
